channel.title: GCSE results?
channel.description:
Well i just got my results and it was
english - b science - b maths - b graphics - b ict - 3 passes art - f RE - c
how did you do?

item.title: GCSE results?
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:36, topic:298191”][quote author=goatee link=topic=394598.msg2938661#msg2938661 date=1251726298]
or I can fight for my country and make a difference.
[/quote]

…

BAHAHAHA

they did a good job on you, son[/quote]

Meh, Americans are patriotic why can’t I be?

Read full topic

Geography: C (C was the highest because it is half a GCSE)

and thats it…

item.title: GCSE results?
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

[quote=“Jamie1200, post:31, topic:298191”][quote author=goatee link=topic=394598.msg2935878#msg2935878 date=1251558698]
Wow matt you’re epic.

Maths - A
English Language - A
English Lit - B
Chemistry - B
Biology - B
Physics - C
DIDA - C
History - C
RE - D
Citizenship - B
Business - B

Woot @ no revision!
Prolly won’t get into sixth form, but I went army office yesterday and it sounds a bit more interesting than A levels.
[/quote]
getting your head blown off buy a bullent sounds more intresting that futher education? Each to their own i suppose.[/quote]

Of course, because all of the British casualties have been from headshots. Hardly anybody gets shot in the head tbh, most deaths are from IEDs.

Further Education is so shit these days because everyone is unemployed and getting these qualifications so that’s going to undervalue them.
So I can go out on the weekends getting pissed and spend the rest of my time doing boring arse coursework or I can fight for my country and make a difference.

Army > A levels.

Read full topic

item.title: GCSE results?
item.dc:creator: @error.login cane
item.description:
@error.login wrote:

[quote=“goatee, post:23, topic:298191”]WTF, okay so you’re fine with going into action and fighting. But food and your hairstyle are the things stopping you?

Also, when on operation you don’t have to shave your hair.[/quote]
Yeah im pretty much fine with the whole concept of action and fighting and the training which i think i will like the most but i hate having my hair shaved its the thing i hate the most, i had it done before but with a number 3 and i hated it.

Read full topic

item.title: GCSE results?
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

Yeah, I was told it was actually the GPs fault that it takes so long because the guy I was talking to had 5 peoples forms ready to fill in but he had yet to hear from their GP. So basically you really have to urge the GP to do something.

What regiment were you thinking of joining? And what job role?

Read full topic

item.title: GCSE results?
item.dc:creator: @spankjava spank
item.description:
@spankjava wrote:

im running at 10:10-10:15 which isnt to bad atm the longest part is waiting to hear from them about ure medical form took around 4-5 weeks so try get that done as quick as u can.

Read full topic

item.description:
@goatee wrote:

[quote=“spank, post:13, topic:298191”][quote author=goatee link=topic=394598.msg2935878#msg2935878 date=1251558698]

Woot @ no revision!
Prolly won’t get into sixth form, but I went army office yesterday and it sounds a bit more interesting than A levels.
[/quote]

Really? I’m gonna try and get my 1.5mile run down to 9:30 mins before I properly apply. I want to impress.
